intro: Glycine max nothosubsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slender soybean, is a botanical variant of the soybean plant. It exhibits morphological differences from standard Glycine max, including a more delicate stem and smaller leaves. This nothosubspecies is typically found in specific ecological niches, often in regions with cooler climates. Its genetic makeup suggests hybridization with other Glycine species, contributing to its unique characteristics. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptability and evolution.
